title: Frank Morgan - Major Changes [FLAC]
description:
Frank Morgan: Major Changes

Recorded direct-to-digital at Clinton Recording Studio, NYC; April 27-29, 1987
Mastered at Fantasy Studios, Berkeley

Release Date	January 14, 1992 (CD)
Label		Contemporary Records
Catalog #	CCD-14039-2
Format		CD
Duration	57:04
Release Info	Instrumental, Studio Recording

Track List:
01 Changes			M Tyner			05:10 	
02 How Deep Is The Ocean?	I Berlin		08:17 	
03 Emily			J Mandel/J Mercer	04:21 	
04 Search for Peace		M Tyner			06:59 	
05 Frank's Back			M Tyner			06:09 	
06 All the Things You Are	O Hammerstein II/J Kern	05:45 	
07 Theme From Love Story	F Lai/C Sigman		10:43
08 So What			M Davis			09:40 	

Personnel:
Frank Morgan - Alto Sax
Avery Sharpe - Bass
Louis Hayes - Drums
McCoy Tyner - Piano

Allmusic Review by Scott Yanow:
Although associated with bebop, altoist Frank Morgan emerged on records in 1985 as a forward-thinking soloist with a gradually evolving sound of his own (despite being in his early 50s). On this worthy set, he is joined by the McCoy Tyner Trio (which consists of the masterful pianist, bassist Avery Sharpe and drummer Louis Hayes) for mostly modern material. Tyner contributed three originals, including "Frank's Back," and the quartet also digs into "How Deep Is the Ocean," "Emily," "All the Things You Are," "So What" and even "Theme from Love Story." Morgan's lyricism works quite well with Tyner's powerful chords, and the results are consistently memorable.
_________________

Not my rip, but not widely available. I've cleaned it up a bit (ID Tags, etc.) but the FLAC files are untouched. Note that Audiochecker reports Track 5 as an MPEG.
